attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Open Centres that provide Class A drugs like Heroin for free to prevent crime.
attributes.background: If there were Centers that provided class A drugs for free and a safe place to take them. Users Registered, agreed to treatment. Then Drug dealers would have no business, muggings, robberies and shoplifting would drop dramatically and few young people would start using.
attributes.additional_details: Open centres across the country. While keeping the sale and use of Heroin illegal elsewhere, in the Centres Heroin and other highly addictive class A drugs would be given to addicts that register and seek treatment. Over night drug dealers would be out of business, muggings, robbery’s, burglary’s and shop lifting would decrease dramatically as addicts no longer need to commit crime. Lastly, drug dealers wouldn’t be pushing drugs onto young naïve people in order to profit from their misery.

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Make tattoo discrimination illegal
attributes.background: Tattoo discrimination, especially in the work place, should be made illegal, judge people by their talent, not by looks

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of tax charged on fuel
attributes.background: Far too much excise duty is placed on fuel leading in increased costs to the consumer

attributes.action: Mobile phone use whilst driving have the same penalties as drink/drugs driving.
attributes.background: Mobile phone use whilst driving appears to be killing or maiming as many people as drink/drug related accidents, therefore should carry the same penalty.

attributes.action: Eliminate residency requirements when determining a British Citizens fee status
attributes.background: As a British citizen, one can expect fair and just treatment in their country; one should not be treated any differently than fellow Britons. Currently, a citizen must live in the UK for the 3 year before starting a university course, which discriminates against citizens who live abroad.
attributes.additional_details: With the current fee status terms, many British citizens are classified as international students when returning to their home. Not only are international fees extortionate, this means that a citizen is treated no differently than a foreigner when they are in their own country. These fees may even impede a citizen from returning home. In order to end this discrimination, fee status should be based upon citizenship; a Briton should be considered a Briton, regardless of where s/he has lived.

attributes.action: All cyclist road users must have insurance and a cycling licence to use the road
attributes.background: As a car owner I have had incidents at the fault of a cyclist.  Damage was caused to my vehicle but because cyclist are uninsured I was unable to call any authority to pay for the damages.  Cyclists can note our registration and go to the police at any time who can then contact our insurance
attributes.additional_details: I was indicating to turn right but waiting for oncoming traffic to give way.  Cyclist overtook on my drivers side knocking my wing mirror off, dent and scratched my door.  Asked why he done that, he answered "sorry my fault, I thought I could get around in time"!  I stayed with him made sure he was OK called the ambulance. A few weeks later I received a letter from Metropolitan Police regarding the incident! I had to pay for the damages to my car although it was not my fault!

attributes.action: Change Religious Education to Religious and Cultural Studies
attributes.background: Students should be taught more than just basic religious principles. Teaching children about other races and cultures will help stamp out racism in our ever-progressing and diverse society.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the biggest cities in the UK (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol and Cardiff) are among the most diverse in Europe. Our youth should be accepting of their peers whatever their heritage, especially in the wake of Brexit and the rising level of hate crime.

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: stop animal cruelty and any type of testing on animals
attributes.background: i think that there are many other ways to test and experiment with different products in a completely cruelty free way, the UK is part of the chain of the biggest animal cruelty users in the world for no apparent reason. Research will show you scientific ways to test out products without animal use.
attributes.additional_details: PETA is a strong animal cruelty free organisation that fight for the animals rights to their own freedom, not including harmful experiments. I also think that people of the public need to be more educated on this controversial topic to understand what actually happens when making their products that they use every single day.

attributes.action: Halt the Department of Education's Autumn Census & destroy all data collected.
attributes.background: The Department of Education's Autumn Census expects parents to disclose their children Country of Birth and state 'National Identity' from a list of Welsh, English, Scottish, Irish, British, Other, or Refuse. Parents should not be asked to determine and disclose the national identity of children.

attributes.action: Raise awareness about Motorcyclist for drivers. Add a Section for Practical test
attributes.background:
Many Car drivers are not very aware of Motorcyclist. I have seen many fatal accidents and it is now time to raise awareness for learners and normal drivers.
If they fail to show any awareness about Motorcyclist they must retake their test.

attributes.action: Nationalise the M6 Toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is currently underused and is a resource that could be used more effectively under national ownership, this would help save time and money not only to businesses but to local and national economies and also help with air pollution experienced on the M6 which has heavy congestion.
attributes.additional_details:
Nationalising the M6 Toll would have numerous benefits from alleviating congestion on the M6 and surrounding roads to helping businesses and local economies of towns that are situated alongside the toll road such as Cannock which is currently having the Mill Green designer outlet village built. 
http://millgreenoutletvillage.co.uk/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35553865
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2015/sep/17/leaving-tackling-air-pollution-to-local-authorities-is-an-inadequate-response

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: Make employers test for cannabis using the saliva test rather than urine.
attributes.background: The urine test for cannabis is thought to be able to detect cannabis taken from upto 2-3 months prior to the test. This is a massive issue as cannabis has no impairment on your work even a day later. The saliva test used by police for roadside testing only detects cannabis taken that day.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is used worldwide as medication and although it could affect the way in which you work, the effects wear off after a few hours.

The test for alcohol in a work place can only detect alcohol taken that day or the day before therefore, the same should apply to cannabis.

Unemployment is already a massive issue in the UK and these tests only make it more difficult for people to maintain their employment wether they use recreationally or for medical purposes.

attributes.action: Employment Support Allowance needs to be changed for people who work.
attributes.background: After being signed off work due to Mental Health problems, I was extremely disappointed to find out that after DWP checked my last twelve months National Insurance contributions I didn't qualify for Employment Support Allowance. In the past 18 months I have reduced my hours due to health problems.
attributes.additional_details: If people are suffering with accident/illness it is fairly common that may have  to reduce their hours to help them through. Therefore, it would be better to no longer use the time limit of twelve months to check NI Contributions when calculating if they qualify for Employment Support Allowance. It think its fair to say it would be better to look at what has been paid for all the years they have worked. This ruling needs to be changed to support workers who are going through difficult times.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park on or in front of a dropped kerb and private driveways.
attributes.background: Current high way code rules recommend that people do not block private driveways. As this is not an illegal action, people suffer the consequences of irresponsible parking by others. The move to make this action illegal and therefore give the police power to discourage problems.

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Organise better system at Dartford Toll. Delays of at least 2 hours unacceptable
attributes.background: I have been using this route for over 30 years and never experienced the delays as I am now, since removing the tolls. Something MUST be dine
attributes.additional_details: It does not matter what time of the day I leave my home in East Sussex, I am delayed for at least 1 and half hours - why??

attributes.action: Make legal, individual to be in possession and smoke small quantity of cannabis
attributes.background: Cannabis is an illegal drug throughout the UK, although there may be scientific evidence to prove that it may be harmful but isn't it an individual's right to make that decision whether is be harmful to themselves or not. It should be legal for small quantity but not enough for distribution
attributes.additional_details: It provides medical benefits that some prescription drugs cannot

attributes.action: Agree never to sell or give our NHS details to anyone outside the NHS.
attributes.background: Apparently this proposal is back again. There is a proposal to sell all our details to the private sector. This was defeated once and needs to be defeated again. Let's get it debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: We demand reform to the honours system to re-establish public trust
attributes.background: Honours nominations by the Prime Minister which are viewed as rewarding (i) financial donations to his/her party or (ii) private service to the Prime Minister and his/her close associates are corrosive of public trust in the political system.
attributes.additional_details: We demand reform of the honours system so that it reflects genuine public service and outstanding achievement as it is meant to do. The current honours committee structure is clearly not robust enough to achieve this. We demand democratic accountability of honours recommendations by the Prime Minister to be strengthened such that they can be scrutinised and/or blocked by Members of Parliament.

attributes.action: Allow Armed forces personal to carry side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.background: Due to the fact there gave been person's attempting abductions against our service personnel it is time to allow them to carry loaded side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.additional_details: RAF Marham. Aldershot

attributes.action: To enforce that the CMS deal with both maintenance & contact thorough mediation
attributes.background: For the CMS to enforce that mediation must be attended by both parents in exchange for their  services. Both contact and maintenance are discussed and put to the courts. Solicitors and mediatiors can attend. Saving so much trouble and heart ache.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last two years I have gone through great troubles to arrange contact with my son Lucas. Since going through this I have noticed that there are several people going through the same... Alienation, unfair judgement in court, expensive solicitors. The CMS has sonics  legal power to peruse the money but don't do the same for contact. Making it easier to seperate a non living parent from their child with no obligation to maintain a healthy relationship between them. This must be stopped .

attributes.action: Improved education on Keeping Britain Tidy and stricter penalties for litterers
attributes.background: Our hedgerows, dykes, residential areas, countryside, roadsides, beaches and rivers, to name some, are strewn with litter and an absolute disgrace to our nation. Sadly some members of society have no shame in dropping their rubbish, thus believing it to be another's responsibility to clean up.

attributes.action: Make the government take a more active role in providing food for those in need.
attributes.background: We are campaigning on behalf of over 1.1 million people in the UK who have needed emergency food supplies from The Trussell Trust in the last year (1). Food bank usage is on the rise, but we believe it is the government's responsibility to provide food for their people, not that of the food banks.
attributes.additional_details:
The emergency food supplied by The Trussell Trust is estimated as less than half the number of the total amount of emergency food supplies distributed in the UK (2). However the government plan to cut welfare by £3bn by 2020 (2).

References:
1. https://www.trusselltrust.org/news-and-blog/latest-stats/#fy-2015-2016
2. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/food-bank-usage-at-record-high-reveals-trussell-trust-a6984921.html

attributes.action: Road works on motorways should require 24/7 working.
attributes.background: Road works on motorways and major public roads should have 24/7 working to reduce loss of trade to local business and increased inconvenience to the UK population. The UK will be globally more effective and prosperous if the UK's transport links are more efficient.
attributes.additional_details: A short term pain, will lead to a long term gain.

attributes.action: Help London workers and locals be home owners: restrict multi-property buying.
attributes.background: London house prices keep soaring, and only wealthy UK and foreign investors benefit as they buy up the capital, at prices only they can afford. Home owning is unattainable for locals and workers living in the capital, making renting their only option. Again, rents are high and saving to buy is hard.
attributes.additional_details:
Laws need to be put into place to restrict mass buying from wealthy individuals, as well control on companies.
London is driven by its workers/locals but house prices are causing people to leave to other cities. Plus those commuting into London are being pushed further out as the outskirts also become unaffordable. 
This petition urges the Government implement laws to help more people become home owners in the Capital, and restrict the benefits to investors raking in ridiculous rental income!

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: Increase funding for an EHCP to allow mainstream schools to get the correct help
attributes.background: I have been fighting for 3 years to get an EHCP for my child, he now has one but with very little funding so he is unable to get the right help at school. He is missing out on education at a very important stage of his life. This process is effecting hundreds of SEN children, it's not fair.

attributes.action: Allow carers to still get paid when, the person they care for is hospitalised.
attributes.background:
Change the cruel rule, where if the person you care for is hospitalised, you have payment stopped, full time careers still have to pay their bills, & sometimes still have to care for that person whilst in hospital.
Or do you expect them to somehow get a job for the duration of the hospital stay?

attributes.action: Improve category 1 plug in car grants after March 2017 review
attributes.background: Category 1 electric vehicle technology is taking off. These cars can now give around 300 miles in range, matching the average internal combustion engine. These electric cars are becoming more attractive to buyers. In order to help the UK beat and exceed emission targets, ev's must be promoted.

attributes.action: All car drivers should be made to do a CPC course like professional drivers.
attributes.background: Driving on today's roads are very challenging and dangerous, when I was recently in a speeding awareness course, 19 out of 20 people where totally clueless about lots of rules and regulations from the highway code, everybody must be retrained for everybody's safety

attributes.action: I want to lower the abortion limit
attributes.background: A baby is a baby from conception but more so knowing it's got a heartbeat at 6-7 weeks. 24 weeks a baby is developed it can survive. I don't agree that a baby can be born before 24 weeks and they won't save it but as soon as it's over 24 weeks they will fight to save the baby.
attributes.additional_details: The abortion limit needs to be lowered to below 12 weeks!!

attributes.action: The National Curriculum to be run and controlled by an Education Council
attributes.background: Education has been used to sway voters for too long now. With each new Government comes a new National Curriculum. New 'ideas' or 'beliefs'. It's time for stability and for education to be in control of professionals and not politicians, by forming an Education Council of former Heads and teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2010, the Education Department has been run by an accountant, a journalist, a solicitor and an economist. What qualifications do they have to decide on the best course of action for our children? The Government are too results driven. Schools should be places where children feel safe, where children go to enjoy learning, where children discover a passion for a given subject area. This is not happening under the current scrutiny from those who don't understand the education system.

attributes.action: Make all motorway matrix signs read Keep Left Unless Overtaking when not in use
attributes.background: Middle-lane-sitting is a common problem for many motorway users, and often results on excessive overtaking speed, undertaking, road rage and congestion. I think this problem is largely caused by ignorance of proper road use and could be eased by instructing drivers to keep left using overhead signs.
attributes.additional_details: As stated in the Highway Code (goo.gl/zagJKH) road users should keep left on the motorway and move back to the left as soon as they have overtaken, however for many drivers it has been years since they learned this rule. The result of this is poor road use resulting in heavy congestion and frustration for others. The overhead announcement boards could easily be used, when not displaying live notices, to say "Keep Left Unless Overtaking" to remind road users of how to use the motorways properly.

attributes.action: The Government should recognise Taiwan's right for national self determination.
attributes.background: The UK Government should revise its view of the 'One China Policy' to recognize that Taiwan is a beacon of democracy in Asia and that it is for the people of Taiwan to decide their future and not the Chinese Communist Party, which is known to be an authoritarian and oppressive government.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not about requesting that the UK Government recognises Taiwan as a country but instead that it recognises that it is for the people of Taiwan to determine their future free of threats from the Chinese Government.

The Chinese Government's claim to control the destiny of the people Taiwan is a dangerous and outdated philosophy based on colonialism. This is because although Taiwan was once part of mainland China it has not been for almost a 120 years.

attributes.action: “To require the Government to repeal Section 40 of the Crime and Courts Act 2013
attributes.background: The majority of British Newspapers want nothing to do with 'Impress' as an 'independent regulator'; because the Freedom of the Press is a rare and treasured commodity.
attributes.additional_details: I refer to the excellent article written by Mr. Fraser Nelson in the Telegraph

attributes.action: Reword Rule 59 of the Highway code from 'should' to 'must'
attributes.background: The current wording of Rule 59 allows cyclists to ignore the suggestions. The rule should be revised so that cyclists MUST wear a safety helmet and at least one article of fluorescent or reflective clothing and/or accessory (visible from front and rear) at all times when cycling on the highway.
attributes.additional_details:
Car drivers and passengers MUST wear a safety belt, therefore it stands to reason that cyclists MUST wear a cycling helmet and a fluorescent/reflective item when cycling. This would help to reduce the number of incidents which occur on the roads.
There were 21,287 reported cycling casualties in 2014. Source: http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/pedal-cyclists/facts-figures/
Many of these could have been avoided if cyclists were easier to see.

attributes.action: National insurance should pay for old peoples care, not council tax
attributes.background:
Council tax is a blunt tool, not related to income, and therefore ability to pay.
Many councils are in financial trouble, because of the squeeze from government, and inflationary pressures.
Government can redistribute cash to the areas that need it. leaving the councils to deal with local issues

attributes.action: Amend voting age to reflect the school year
attributes.background:
This petition aims to grant the right to vote to second-year college students; in other words, to 17-year-olds who will pass their 18th birthday within the same school year as the vote.

We should recognise that students in the same school year have the same intellectual and cultural maturity.
attributes.additional_details:
To make an adequate generalisation about the societal and cultural awareness of young people, it would make much more sense to rely on their years of education; limiting voting by age is arbitrary.

For example, in the General Election 2015, students in their final year of college were only eligible to vote depending on whether their 18th birthday fell before or after May 7th. We should recognise that a period of a few days is inconsequential.

Colleges could then encourage youth participation.

attributes.action: Stop all chain supermarkets selling eggs from battery and barn hens by 2018
attributes.background: We read about the poor conditions that some animals live in and want to end the cruelty. Chickens are a start to achieving our goal because the effects gained from this would be most beneficial.
attributes.additional_details: There are already systems being put into place by some stores, but these aren't expected to come into action for several years. We think that this change should happen quicker so that there is no more unnecessary suffering in the egg industry. We hope that by doing this the supermarkets will eventually eliminate all products that leave animals in terrible, cruel and inhumane situations.
